title: Trumps Will Be Dancing, Not Listening, On Oscar Night
text:
Trumps Will Be Dancing, Not Listening, On Oscar Night "... a phenomenal event." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
As Hollywood’s stars deliver their off-the-cuff condemnations of President Donald Trump at Sunday night’s Academy Awards, the president and first lady Melania Trump will be having a ball. 
Literally. 
Sunday night is the annual Governors Ball , a part of the National Governors Association meetings in Washington. Advertisement - story continues below Emails Show Current EPA Chief Worked With Oil Interests As Oklahoma AG 
“Mrs. Trump looks forward to putting on a phenomenal event,” White House press secretary Sean Spicer said Wednesday. 
“The first lady’s put a lot of time into this event that’s going to occur, welcoming our nation’s governors to the capital and I have a feeling that’s where the president and the first lady are going to be focused on Sunday night,” he added. 
“And so we’ll go from there,” Spicer told media outlets wondering how Trump would reply to the expected onslaught of criticism from Hollywood’s elite. Advertisement – story continues below 
During Wednesday’s news briefing, San Francisco Chronicle columnist Debra Saunders cited what she called the “Meryl Streep moment” and asked Spicer why Hollywood celebrities were opposing Trump. As one reporter noted, the question brought a reaction, but not from Spicer. As the Oscars question was asked @KellyannePolls literally buried her head in her hand 
— Shane Goldmacher (@ShaneGoldmacher) February 22, 2017 
“I have no idea, it’s a free country,” he said, adding, “I think Hollywood is known for being rather far to the left in its opinion.” Advertisement - story continues below
